thread.title: Formula One: Who’s saying what at the United States Grand Prix
thread.title_full: Formula One: Who’s saying what at the United States Grand Prix

title: Formula One: Who’s saying what at the United States Grand Prix
text:
Print Article 
Mercedes driver Lewis Hamilton (44) of Great Britain celebrates winning the United States Grand Prix and the F1 world championships at the Circuit of the Americas. — Reuters pic AUSTIN (Texas) Oct 26 — Who’s saying what at the United States Grand Prix yesterday after Lewis Hamilton captured the race and a third world drivers’ title: 
“This is the greatest moment of my life.” — Lewis Hamilton. 
“I owe so much to them—my mum, my dad, my family, with all they sacrificed.” — Hamilton. 
“I remember my first British Championship when my dad drove me home singing ‘We Are The Champions’.” — Hamilton on his early days. 
“Something like that has never happened to me ever. Can’t explain it. Really tough to lose the lead and the win like that.” — Nico Rosberg after his fatal error on lap 49 which handed the race to Mercedes teammate Hamilton. 
“Nico has been a fantastic teammate and has driven so well since we’ve been teammates, so big respect to him.” — Hamilton on his German teammate. 
“Lewis was almost faultless this year and the car didn’t let him down. It is just an amazing feeling.” — Mercedes team chief Tito Woolf 
“Nico could easily have won the race but Lewis drove his race to win it. It was Nico’s to lose and that is what happened.” — Former fellow three-time world champion Jackie Stewart. 
“He has every chance of wining more titles. It could be 5 or 6, Mercedes is so superior.” — Stewart again. 
“Congratulations to Mercs and Lewis wonderful finish for US Grand Prix great Champion. Congrats to all drivers today.” — 1992 world champion Nigel Mansell on Twitter. 
“Congratulations to @LewisHamilton on the championship! Really strong performance and well deserved!!” — McLaren’s Fernando Alonso, a former teammate of Hamilton, on Twitter. 
“Congrats Lewis @LewisHamilton well deserved race win and 3 rd #F1world Title!! You definitely rock!” — 1978 world champion Mario Andretti on Twitter. — AFP
